透.definition: (bound form) to penetrate; to seep through; to tell secretly; to leak; thoroughly; through and through; to appear; to show

透信.definition: to disclose information; to tip off

透射.definition: to transmit; transmission (of radiation through a medium); passage

透底.definition: to disclose inside information; to divulge secret details

透支.definition: (banking) to overdraw; to take out an overdraft; an overdraft; to overspend (i.e. expenditure in excess of revenue); (old) to draw one's wage in advance; (fig.) to exhaust (one's enthusiasm, energy etc); to damage a natural resource through overuse

透析.definition: to analyze in depth; dialysis; (chemistry) to dialyze; (medicine) to undergo dialysis treatment

透氣.definition: to flow freely (of air); to ventilate; to breathe (of fabric etc); to take a breath of fresh air; to divulge

透漏.definition: to divulge; to leak; to reveal

透澈.definition: variant of 透徹|透彻[tou4 che4]

透視.definition: (drawing and painting) perspective; (medicine) to perform fluoroscopy; to examine by X-ray; (fig.) to take a penetrating look at sth; to gain insight

透過.definition: to pass through; to penetrate; by means of; via

透露.definition: to leak out; to divulge; to reveal

透風.definition: to let air pass through; to ventilate
